meanings.definition: Search for and collect (anything usable) from discarded waste.
meanings.sent1: The raccoon scavenged through the trash cans for food.
meanings.sent2: The vulture scavenged the remains of the carcass.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scavenged the park for acorns to store in its nest.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur scavenged the market for new business opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The pirate scavenged the island for buried treasure.

meanings.definition: Clean or remove unwanted material from (a place).
meanings.sent1: The janitor scavenged the hallway for litter.
meanings.sent2: She scavenged the old barn to make space for new equipment.
meanings.sent3: The robot scavenged the factory floor of debris to prevent accidents.
meanings.sent4: The gardener scavenged the garden bed of weeds to allow the flowers to thrive.
meanings.sent5: The maid scavenged the hotel room for lost items left by guests.

meanings.definition: Obtain (something) at little or no cost.
meanings.sent1: She scavenged free samples at the grocery store.
meanings.sent2: The student scavenged discarded textbooks at the end of the semester.
meanings.sent3: The cat scavenged a cozy spot by the fireplace without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent4: He scavenged valuable information from the internet for his research project.
meanings.sent5: The family scavenged furniture from yard sales to furnish their new home.
